hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition via Miner Revenue Hash Price Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: During BEAR regimes, when Bitcoin's hash price (miner revenue per TH/s) makes a higher low while price makes a lower low over a 14-day period, and miner outflow metric (7-day MA) drops below 0.5, a transition to NEUTRAL regime will occur within 14 days with >68% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Miner capitulation ending (reduced outflows) combined with improving hash economics suggests selling pressure exhaustion. Hash price divergence indicates underlying network strength despite price weakness.
entry_conditions: Hash price higher low vs price lower low (14-day period)
BTC price stabilizes within 5% range for 5 days

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Hash price breaks to new lows or miner outflow spikes > 1.5

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 32% of such divergences fail to produce NEUTRAL transition within 14 days, or price breaks down further despite hash price strength in >35% of cases.
